        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-keystrokes></mr-keystrokes>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

            Issue 1420885: ServiceWorkers in credentialless iframes could access long lived cookies
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1420885: ServiceWorkers in credentialless iframes could access long lived cookies
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

      maury...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->maury...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>

            on 
      Thu, Mar 2, 2023, 3:55 AM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Mar 2, 2023, 3:55 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>

      ---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br><br>### Report description<span class="line"><!---->### Report description<!----></span><br><br><br>ServiceWorkers in credentialless iframes could access long lived cookies<span class="line"><!---->ServiceWorkers in credentialless iframes could access long lived cookies<!----></span><br><br><br>---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br><br>### Bug location<span class="line"><!---->### Bug location<!----></span><br><br><br>#### Which product or website have you found a vulnerability in?<span class="line"><!---->#### Which product or website have you found a vulnerability in?<!----></span><br><br>Google Chrome<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome<!----></span><br><br><br>---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br><br>### The problem<span class="line"><!---->### The problem<!----></span><br><br><br>#### Please describe the technical details of the vulnerability<span class="line"><!---->#### Please describe the technical details of the vulnerability<!----></span><br><br>Starting from the following assumption I've tried to check if it's possible to bypass the restriction and access long-lived cookies from a `credentialless` iframe:<span class="line"><!---->Starting from the following assumption I've tried to check if it's possible to bypass the restriction and access long-lived cookies from a `credentialless` iframe:<!----></span><br>> "The `credentialless` attribute allows embedding third party iframes in a COEP: credentialless mode, i.e. the frame itself doesn't have cookies and all outgoing requests will be performed without credentials." <span class="line"><!---->&gt; "The `credentialless` attribute allows embedding third party iframes in a COEP: credentialless mode, i.e. the frame itself doesn't have cookies and all outgoing requests will be performed without credentials." <!----></span><br><br>While testing `serviceWorkers` I've discovered that if a `serverWorker` is created in a `credentialless` iframe, it is able to access long-lived cookies outside of the context of the `credentialless` iframe.<span class="line"><!---->While testing `serviceWorkers` I've discovered that if a `serverWorker` is created in a `credentialless` iframe, it is able to access long-lived cookies outside of the context of the `credentialless` iframe.<!----></span><br><br>PoC:<span class="line"><!---->PoC:<!----></span><br>1. Download the attached poc.zip<span class="line"><!---->1. Download the attached poc.zip<!----></span><br>2. Extract poc.zip<span class="line"><!---->2. Extract poc.zip<!----></span><br>3. Spawn terminal1 and use it to run `php -S 127.0.0.1:8000` inside the `one` folder<span class="line"><!---->3. Spawn terminal1 and use it to run `php -S 127.0.0.1:8000` inside the `one` folder<!----></span><br>4. Spawn terminal2 and use it to run `php -S 127.0.0.1:8001` inside the `two` folder<span class="line"><!---->4. Spawn terminal2 and use it to run `php -S 127.0.0.1:8001` inside the `two` folder<!----></span><br>5. Browse <span class="line"><!---->5. Browse <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1:8000<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1:8000"><!---->http://127.0.0.1:8000<!----></a><br>6. Click "Set Cookie" to browse once <span class="line"><!---->6. Click "Set Cookie" to browse once <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1:8001/index.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1:8001/index.html"><!---->http://127.0.0.1:8001/index.html<!----></a> and get a long-lived cookie set<span class="line"><!----> and get a long-lived cookie set<!----></span><br>7. Refresh <span class="line"><!---->7. Refresh <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1:8000<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1:8000"><!---->http://127.0.0.1:8000<!----></a> with the dev tools opened<span class="line"><!----> with the dev tools opened<!----></span><br>8. Notice that a request is sent to <span class="line"><!---->8. Notice that a request is sent to <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1:8001/debug_cookie.php?js<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1:8001/debug_cookie.php?js"><!---->http://127.0.0.1:8001/debug_cookie.php?js<!----></a> from the `credentialless` iframe which does contain the cookie `this_is_a_short_lived_cookie=1` which is set inside the iframe itself<span class="line"><!----> from the `credentialless` iframe which does contain the cookie `this_is_a_short_lived_cookie=1` which is set inside the iframe itself<!----></span><br>9. Notice that a request is sent to <span class="line"><!---->9. Notice that a request is sent to <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1:8001/debug_cookie.php?sw<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1:8001/debug_cookie.php?sw"><!---->http://127.0.0.1:8001/debug_cookie.php?sw<!----></a> from the `serverWorker` loaded inside the `credentialless` iframe which does contain the cookie `this_is_a_long_lived_cookie=1` which was set by <span class="line"><!----> from the `serverWorker` loaded inside the `credentialless` iframe which does contain the cookie `this_is_a_long_lived_cookie=1` which was set by <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1:8001/index.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1:8001/index.html"><!---->http://127.0.0.1:8001/index.html<!----></a><br><br><br><br>#### Please briefly explain who can exploit the vulnerability, and what they gain when doing so<span class="line"><!---->#### Please briefly explain who can exploit the vulnerability, and what they gain when doing so<!----></span><br><br>A cross-origin page loaded inside a `credentialless` iframe could create a service worker and access long-lived cookies in the request and bypass the security boundary imposed by the `credentialless` flag.<span class="line"><!---->A cross-origin page loaded inside a `credentialless` iframe could create a service worker and access long-lived cookies in the request and bypass the security boundary imposed by the `credentialless` flag.<!----></span><br><br><br>---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br><br>### The cause<span class="line"><!---->### The cause<!----></span><br><br><br>#### What version of Chrome have you found the security issue in?<span class="line"><!---->#### What version of Chrome have you found the security issue in?<!----></span><br><br>110.0.5481.177 (Official Build) (arm64) <span class="line"><!---->110.0.5481.177 (Official Build) (arm64) <!----></span><br><br><br>#### Is the security issue related to a crash?<span class="line"><!---->#### Is the security issue related to a crash?<!----></span><br><br>No<span class="line"><!---->No<!----></span><br><br><br>#### Choose the type of vulnerability<span class="line"><!---->#### Choose the type of vulnerability<!----></span><br><br>Other<span class="line"><!---->Other<!----></span><br><br><br>#### How would you like to be publicly acknowledged for your report?<span class="line"><!---->#### How would you like to be publicly acknowledged for your report?<!----></span><br><br>Abdel Adim `smaury` Oisfi of Shielder<span class="line"><!---->Abdel Adim `smaury` Oisfi of Shielder<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Sorry for that - I've uploaded an incomplete PoC :(<span class="line"><!---->Sorry for that - I've uploaded an incomplete PoC :(<!----></span><br>Here you go the final version where you have everything matching the steps I shared previously.<span class="line"><!---->Here you go the final version where you have everything matching the steps I shared previously.<!----></span><br><br>This is the diff FYI:<span class="line"><!---->This is the diff FYI:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>diff -r poc/two/simple.html poc_new/two/simple.html<span class="line"><!---->diff -r poc/two/simple.html poc_new/two/simple.html<!----></span><br>19a20<span class="line"><!---->19a20<!----></span><br>>       fetch("/debug_cookie.php?js")<span class="line"><!---->&gt;       fetch("/debug_cookie.php?js")<!----></span><br>diff -r poc/two/sw.js poc_new/two/sw.js<span class="line"><!---->diff -r poc/two/sw.js poc_new/two/sw.js<!----></span><br>2c2<span class="line"><!---->2c2<!----></span><br><   fetch("/debug_cookie.php")<span class="line"><!---->&lt;   fetch("/debug_cookie.php")<!----></span><br>---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br>>   fetch("/debug_cookie.php?sw")<span class="line"><!---->&gt;   fetch("/debug_cookie.php?sw")<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        My understanding is that we do have "partitioned worker", given the test:<span class="line"><!---->My understanding is that we do have "partitioned worker", given the test:<!----></span><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/web_tests/external/wpt/html/anonymous-iframe/serviceworker-partitioning.tentative.https.window.js;bpv=0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/web_tests/external/wpt/html/anonymous-iframe/serviceworker-partitioning.tentative.https.window.js;bpv=0"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/web_tests/external/wpt/html/anonymous-iframe/serviceworker-partitioning.tentative.https.window.js;bpv=0<!----></a><br><br>That is to say, the iframe credentialless is talking to a dedicated service worker. The problem is that the ServiceWorker itself is using the general cookie partition.<span class="line"><!---->That is to say, the iframe credentialless is talking to a dedicated service worker. The problem is that the ServiceWorker itself is using the general cookie partition.<!----></span><br><br>In term of security impact: it bypasses the iframe credentialless protection for website using service worker. However Chrome does also enforce SiteIsolation inside cross-origin-isolated page on top of it, so you can't exfiltrate the data via Spectre anyway. So there should be no real security impact.<span class="line"><!---->In term of security impact: it bypasses the iframe credentialless protection for website using service worker. However Chrome does also enforce SiteIsolation inside cross-origin-isolated page on top of it, so you can't exfiltrate the data via Spectre anyway. So there should be no real security impact.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        > Is that always the case, even on low-end Android devices where we are severely memory-constrained?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Is that always the case, even on low-end Android devices where we are severely memory-constrained?<!----></span><br><br>It is unclear to me, because the process selection is of considerable size.<span class="line"><!---->It is unclear to me, because the process selection is of considerable size.<!----></span><br><br>My understanding is that:<span class="line"><!---->My understanding is that:<!----></span><br><br>1. Independently of the platform, the process will be marked as not suitable if it wasn't configured with crossOriginIsolation here:<span class="line"><!---->1. Independently of the platform, the process will be marked as not suitable if it wasn't configured with crossOriginIsolation here:<!----></span><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_process_host_impl.cc;l=4315-4321;drc=bec0ef46974cd9a6bc0f1f1ae34baa11913f77af<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_process_host_impl.cc;l=4315-4321;drc=bec0ef46974cd9a6bc0f1f1ae34baa11913f77af"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_process_host_impl.cc;l=4315-4321;drc=bec0ef46974cd9a6bc0f1f1ae34baa11913f77af<!----></a><br><br>2. In the event of no suitable process, we call RenderProcessHost::ShouldTryToUseExistingProcessHost(). Android has "unlimited" processes: <span class="line"><!---->2. Android has "unlimited" processes: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_process_host_impl.cc;l=1374?q=renderprocesshost%20selection&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_process_host_impl.cc;l=1374?q=renderprocesshost%20selection&amp;ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_process_host_impl.cc;l=1374?q=renderprocesshost%20selection&amp;ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc<!----></a><br>so, it will always return false.<span class="line"><!---->so, it will always return false.<!----></span><br>(The OS will start to kill some under memory pressure)<span class="line"><!---->(The OS will start to kill some under memory pressure)<!----></span><br><br>3. Whatever happens, we double-check the process is always "suitable" in case of reuse: <span class="line"><!---->3.           <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1420885#c18">Comment 18<!----></a>

          
        by

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1420885#c18">Comment 18<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Mar 8, 2023, 12:23 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>

          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Internals>Sandbox>SiteIsolation
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Internals&gt;Sandbox&gt;SiteIsolation
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        titouan@ is correct that not all Android devices use Site Isolation, and even Android devices with sufficient RAM do not have full Site Isolation.  That means a "suitable" process (in terms of <span class="line"><!---->titouan@ is correct that not all Android devices use Site Isolation, and even Android devices with sufficient RAM do not have full Site Isolation.  That means a "suitable" process (in terms of <!----></span>comment 16<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c16"><!---->comment 16<!----></a>) may include cross-site pages in those cases.<span class="line"><!---->) may include cross-site pages in those cases.<!----></span><br><br>For the purposes of this bug, I think that means:<span class="line"><!---->For the purposes of this bug, I think that means:<!----></span><br><br>1) There's not much security impact on desktop platforms, where full Site Isolation is enabled.  We should still prevent ServiceWorkers of credentialless iframes from accessing long-lived cookies, but a third-party iframe in a COI-enabled page won't live in the same process, and can't use something like Spectre to leak the cookies / data.<span class="line"><!---->1) There's not much security impact on desktop platforms, where full Site Isolation is enabled.  We should still prevent ServiceWorkers of credentialless iframes from accessing long-lived cookies, but a third-party iframe in a COI-enabled page won't live in the same process, and can't use something like Spectre to leak the cookies / data.<!----></span><br><br>2) On 2GB+ Android devices, we try to use Site Isolation in cases it matters most (<span class="line"><!---->2) On 2GB+ Android devices, we try to use Site Isolation in cases it matters most (<!----></span>https://security.googleblog.com/2021/07/protecting-more-with-site-isolation.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://security.googleblog.com/2021/07/protecting-more-with-site-isolation.html"><!---->https://security.googleblog.com/2021/07/protecting-more-with-site-isolation.html<!----></a>),<span class="line"><!---->),<!----></span> but not all sites are isolated.  A COI-enabled page could use this bug to access cookies of a non-isolated site in an iframe.  That seems important to fix.<span class="line"><!----> but not all sites are isolated.  A COI-enabled page could use this bug to access cookies of a non-isolated site in an iframe.  That seems important to fix.<!----></span><br><br>3) On <2GB Android devices, Site Isolation is not enabled and this bug looks like it matters for all sites.<span class="line"><!---->3) On &lt;2GB Android devices, Site Isolation is not enabled and this bug looks like it matters for all sites.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        Comment 19<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c19"><!---->Comment 19<!----></a>: I'm not a security sheriff, but I would consider this a partially-mitigated COI credentialless bypass (since it only works in the case that Site Isolation doesn't apply).<span class="line"><!---->: I'm not a security sheriff, but I would consider this a partially-mitigated COI credentialless bypass (since it only works in the case that Site Isolation doesn't apply).<!----></span><br><br>Do you know how COI credentialless bypasses are usually rated?         Thanks everyone to helping clarifying the impact!<span class="line"><!---->Thanks everyone to helping clarifying the impact!<!----></span><br><br>So my understanding here is that we have two different scenarios/impacts:<span class="line"><!---->So my understanding here is that we have two different scenarios/impacts:<!----></span><br>1. From the `credentialless` perspective we have a bypass of the security feature as a `credentialless` iframe could access the long-lived cookies if it implements a `ServiceWorker`. This is true even though COEP is not present and breaks this assumption of `credentialless` iframes: "IFrame credentialless provides a mechanism for developers to load third-party resources in <iframe>s using a new, ephemeral context. It doesn't have access to its regular origin's network, cookies, and storage data." - <span class="line"><!---->1. From the `credentialless` perspective we have a bypass of the security feature as a `credentialless` iframe could access the long-lived cookies if it implements a `ServiceWorker`. This is true even though COEP is not present and breaks this assumption of `credentialless` iframes: "IFrame credentialless provides a mechanism for developers to load third-party resources in &lt;iframe&gt;s using a new, ephemeral context. It doesn't have access to its regular origin's network, cookies, and storage data." - <!----></span>https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Security/IFrame_credentialless<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Security/IFrame_credentialless"><!---->https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Security/IFrame_credentialless<!----></a><br>2. From a `Site Isolation` perspective we might have some bypasses based on specific factors which are very well highlighted by creis in <span class="line"><!---->2. From a `Site Isolation` perspective we might have some bypasses based on specific factors which are very well highlighted by creis in <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1420885#c18<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1420885#c18"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1420885#c18<!----></a><br><br>Does it make sense to you?<span class="line"><!---->Does it make sense to you?<!----></span><br><br>If yes - we could assume 1 is a bypass of a security boundary and 2 is just a partial bypass (as it depends on various factors), so maybe 1 should be High and 2 should be Medium or even Low?<span class="line"><!---->If yes - we could assume 1 is a bypass of a security boundary and 2 is just a partial bypass (as it depends on various factors), so maybe 1 should be High and 2 should be Medium or even Low?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        > From the `credentialless` perspective we have a bypass of the security feature as a `credentialless` iframe<span class="line"><!---->&gt; From the `credentialless` perspective we have a bypass of the security feature as a `credentialless` iframe<!----></span><br><br>Exactly.<span class="line"><!---->Exactly.<!----></span><br><br>> From a `Site Isolation` perspective we might have some bypasses<span class="line"><!---->&gt; From a `Site Isolation` perspective we might have some bypasses<!----></span><br><br>I don't think these are bypasses, but rather known limitations with Site Isolation, which is too expensive to enable on all platforms and devices. These limitations mean that the credentialless bypass reported here is only partially mitigated by Site Isolation - not fully, like <span class="line"><!---->I don't think these are bypasses, but rather known limitations with Site Isolation, which is too expensive to enable on all platforms and devices. These limitations mean that the credentialless bypass reported here is only partially mitigated by Site Isolation - not fully, like <!----></span>comment #14<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c14"><!---->comment #14<!----></a> suggested.<span class="line"><!----> suggested.<!----></span><br><br>> I'm not a security sheriff<span class="line"><!---->&gt; I'm not a security sheriff<!----></span><br><br>Sorry, my mistake! Thanks for answering my question anyway :)<span class="line"><!---->Sorry, my mistake! Thanks for answering my question anyway :)<!----></span><br><br>> Do you know how COI credentialless bypasses are usually rated?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Do you know how COI credentialless bypasses are usually rated?<!----></span><br><br>I think this might be the first such bug since we shipped (arthursonzogni@, correct me if I'm wrong): <span class="line"><!---->I think this might be the first such bug since we shipped (arthursonzogni@, correct me if I'm wrong): <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/list?q=component%3ABlink%3ESecurityFeature%3EAnonymousIframe%20Type%3DBug-Security&can=1<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/list?q=component%3ABlink%3ESecurityFeature%3EAnonymousIframe%20Type%3DBug-Security&amp;can=1"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/list?q=component%3ABlink%3ESecurityFeature%3EAnonymousIframe%20Type%3DBug-Security&amp;can=1<!----></a><br><br>So we get to decide the severity here and now!<span class="line"><!---->So we get to decide the severity here and now!<!----></span><br><br>Guidelines are here: <span class="line"><!---->Guidelines are here: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/severity-guidelines.md<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/severity-guidelines.md"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/severity-guidelines.md<!----></a><br><br>> High severity vulnerabilities allow an attacker to execute code in the context of, or otherwise impersonate other origins or read cross-origin data.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; High severity vulnerabilities allow an attacker to execute code in the context of, or otherwise impersonate other origins or read cross-origin data.<!----></span><br><br>> Medium severity bugs allow attackers to read or modify limited amounts of information, or are not harmful on their own but potentially harmful when combined with other bugs. This includes information leaks that could be useful in potential memory corruption exploits, or exposure of sensitive user information that an attacker can exfiltrate.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Medium severity bugs allow attackers to read or modify limited amounts of information, or are not harmful on their own but potentially harmful when combined with other bugs. This includes information leaks that could be useful in potential memory corruption exploits, or exposure of sensitive user information that an attacker can exfiltrate.<!----></span><br><br>In a vacuum, I think credentialless bypasses qualify as High severity. A COI page can embed some supposedly-credentialless/actually-credentialled cross-origin resources and then read their contents with Spectre. This maps to "read cross-origin data".<span class="line"><!---->In a vacuum, I think credentialless bypasses qualify as High severity. A COI page can embed some supposedly-credentialless/actually-credentialled cross-origin resources and then read their contents with Spectre. This maps to "read cross-origin data".<!----></span><br><br>Now, there are several caveats in this case:<span class="line"><!---->Now, there are several caveats in this case:<!----></span><br><br>1. The SharedArrayBuffer deprecation trial on desktop is still ongoing, so an attacker need not use credentialless on those platforms<span class="line"><!---->1. The SharedArrayBuffer deprecation trial on desktop is still ongoing, so an attacker need not use credentialless on those platforms<!----></span><br>2. In any case, Site Isolation prevents the attack on desktop and some Android devices<span class="line"><!---->2. In any case, Site Isolation prevents the attack on desktop and some Android devices<!----></span><br>3. The victim page must use a service worker (and credentialled data must be passed back, but that seems very likely: the SW proxies requests)<span class="line"><!---->3. The victim page must use a service worker (and credentialled data must be passed back, but that seems very likely: the SW proxies requests)<!----></span><br><br>> going down one level [...] seems like it would be right<span class="line"><!---->&gt; going down one level [...] seems like it would be right<!----></span><br><br>I agree that since it's partially mitigated, and the victim must use a service worker, we can downgrade it one level.<span class="line"><!---->I agree that since it's partially mitigated, and the victim must use a service worker, we can downgrade it one level.<!----></span><br><br>That lands on a Medium severity. Does that sound right?<span class="line"><!---->That lands on a Medium severity. Does that sound right?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1420885#c30">Comment 30<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Mar 15, 2023, 2:00 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1420885#c30">Comment 30<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Mar 15, 2023, 2:00 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          arthu...@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          wanderview@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          arthu...@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          wanderview@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        How do credentialless iframes request the partitioned cookie jar from the network stack code?<span class="line"><!---->How do credentialless iframes request the partitioned cookie jar from the network stack code?<!----></span><br><br>In service workers we have the storage key which includes the appropriate nonce.  In terms of storage partitioning this is primarily used to partition the service worker database of registrations.  I don't see comments suggesting that it is broken here.<span class="line"><!---->In service workers we have the storage key which includes the appropriate nonce.  In terms of storage partitioning this is primarily used to partition the service worker database of registrations.  I don't see comments suggesting that it is broken here.<!----></span><br><br>We are also attempting to populate the NIK (or whatever it's called these days) appropriately, but perhaps we are missing something.  I believe this would ensure that site-for-cookies is set properly.  But it sounds like the issue here is with something other than site-for-cookies?<span class="line"><!---->We are also attempting to populate the NIK (or whatever it's called these days) appropriately, but perhaps we are missing something.  I believe this would ensure that site-for-cookies is set properly.  But it sounds like the issue here is with something other than site-for-cookies?<!----></span><br><br>In particular, we only really know the storage key has a nonce.  I'm not sure if this looks the same as a sandboxed iframe with an opaque origin or if we can distinguish a credentialless iframe.  So if there is some kind of special logic required for credentialless we might need some additional plumbing.<span class="line"><!---->In particular, we only really know the storage key has a nonce.  I'm not sure if this looks the same as a sandboxed iframe with an opaque origin or if we can distinguish a credentialless iframe.  So if there is some kind of special logic required for credentialless we might need some additional plumbing.<!----></span><br><br>Happy to help more, but routing this back for questions.<span class="line"><!---->Happy to help more, but routing this back for questions.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Mar 16, 2023, 5:13 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        > How do credentialless iframes request the partitioned cookie jar from the network stack code?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; How do credentialless iframes request the partitioned cookie jar from the network stack code?<!----></span><br><br>I believe they use a nonce which is plumbed into the relevant keys (see 10. in the design doc [1]), including the storage key.<span class="line"><!---->I believe they use a nonce which is plumbed into the relevant keys (see 10. in the design doc [1]), including the storage key.<!----></span><br><br>> We are also attempting to populate the NIK (or whatever it's called these days) appropriately, but perhaps we are missing something.  I believe this would ensure that site-for-cookies is set properly.  But it sounds like the issue here is with something other than site-for-cookies?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; We are also attempting to populate the NIK (or whatever it's called these days) appropriately, but perhaps we are missing something.  I believe this would ensure that site-for-cookies is set properly.  But it sounds like the issue here is with something other than site-for-cookies?<!----></span><br><br>Not sure if `net::CookiePartitionKey` is derived automatically from the NIK, but in my (inexperienced) eyes, it sounds like the cookie partition key is wrong: even though the service worker is partitioned (in the database, per the first test in <span class="line"><!---->Not sure if `net::CookiePartitionKey` is derived automatically from the NIK, but in my (inexperienced) eyes, it sounds like the cookie partition key is wrong: even though the service worker is partitioned (in the database, per the first test in <!----></span>comment #26<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c26"><!---->comment #26<!----></a>), it seems to have access to the unpartitioned cookie jar.<span class="line"><!---->), it seems to have access to the unpartitioned cookie jar.<!----></span><br><br>> In particular, we only really know the storage key has a nonce.  I'm not sure if this looks the same as a sandboxed iframe with an opaque origin or if we can distinguish a credentialless iframe.  So if there is some kind of special logic required for credentialless we might need some additional plumbing.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; In particular, we only really know the storage key has a nonce.  I'm not sure if this looks the same as a sandboxed iframe with an opaque origin or if we can distinguish a credentialless iframe.  So if there is some kind of special logic required for credentialless we might need some additional plumbing.<!----></span><br><br>I think the nonce is all you need - credentialless documents set it, and AFAICT share that logic with e.g. fenced frames.<span class="line"><!---->I think the nonce is all you need - credentialless documents set it, and AFAICT share that logic with e.g. fenced frames.<!----></span><br><br>Arthur, please correct me if I'm wrong!<span class="line"><!---->Arthur, please correct me if I'm wrong!<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://docs.google.com/document/d/1poI75BaQ9aqcMGJn_K01-QHsQQbEOwRWvg3Af4VWTmY/edit#heading=h.e14quei5uc0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1poI75BaQ9aqcMGJn_K01-QHsQQbEOwRWvg3Af4VWTmY/edit#heading=h.e14quei5uc0"><!---->https://docs.google.com/document/d/1poI75BaQ9aqcMGJn_K01-QHsQQbEOwRWvg3Af4VWTmY/edit#heading=h.e14quei5uc0<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I investigated whether the code from <span class="line"><!---->I investigated whether the code from <!----></span>comment#32<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c32"><!---->comment#32<!----></a> could be the issue, but it doesn't appear to be. Thinking about what partitions cookies, from talking with mmenke@ about this, SiteForCookies is used for SameSite=Strict cookies and initiator is used for SameSite=Lax cookies. From a quick look it doesn't seem like the PoC uses SameSite=Strict cookies, so maybe the initiator is being used in a way that doesn't correctly factor in whether a credentialless iframe is being used?<span class="line"><!----> could be the issue, but it doesn't appear to be. Thinking about what partitions cookies, from talking with mmenke@ about this, SiteForCookies is used for SameSite=Strict cookies and initiator is used for SameSite=Lax cookies. From a quick look it doesn't seem like the PoC uses SameSite=Strict cookies, so maybe the initiator is being used in a way that doesn't correctly factor in whether a credentialless iframe is being used?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 38<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1420885#c38">Comment 38<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      bingler@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/2227058205" title="bingler@chromium.org"><!---->bingler@chromium.org<!----></a>
      bingler@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->bingler@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Mon, Mar 20, 2023, 12:57 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Mar 20, 2023, 12:57 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1420885#c38">Comment 38<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Mar 20, 2023, 12:57 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1420885#c38">Comment 38<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Mar 20, 2023, 12:57 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        To clarify some cookie concepts:<span class="line"><!---->To clarify some cookie concepts:<!----></span><br><br>Samesite is orthogonal to partitioning, it deals with when to make cookies accessible in cross-site contexts. There can appear to be some behavioral overlaps (for example, a SameSite=Strict will never be shown in a 3rd party iframe which could make it look like it's partitioned to its origin) but SameSite and partitioning are different. <span class="line"><!---->Samesite is orthogonal to partitioning, it deals with when to make cookies accessible in cross-site contexts. There can appear to be some behavioral overlaps (for example, a SameSite=Strict will never be shown in a 3rd party iframe which could make it look like it's partitioned to its origin) but SameSite and partitioning are different. <!----></span><br><br>The SiteForCookies is used as one piece of information to determine if SameSite=Strict or SameSite=Lax cookies should be accessible. When the SiteForCookies is null, neither Lax nor Strict cookies are accessible. But, SameSite=none cookies are accessible.<span class="line"><!---->The SiteForCookies is used as one piece of information to determine if SameSite=Strict or SameSite=Lax cookies should be accessible. When the SiteForCookies is null, neither Lax nor Strict cookies are accessible. But, SameSite=none cookies are accessible.<!----></span><br><br>As for actually partitioning cookies, by default cookies are "partitioned" by the domain setting them. By default I mean any simple cookie: `Set-Cookie: foo=bar`. <span class="line"><!---->As for actually partitioning cookies, by default cookies are "partitioned" by the domain setting them. By default I mean any simple cookie: `Set-Cookie: foo=bar`. <!----></span><br>Any cookie set by the same domain is in the same partition. This has been the case for many years. This is slightly muddied by the `Domain` attribute, but it's "correct enough" to say they're partitioned by their domain.<span class="line"><!---->Any cookie set by the same domain is in the same partition. This has been the case for many years. This is slightly muddied by the `Domain` attribute, but it's "correct enough" to say they're partitioned by their domain.<!----></span><br><br>Recently however we added a new concept of partitioning which uses the partitioned attribute: `Set-Cookie: foo2=bar2; partitioned; ...(some other attributes)...`<span class="line"><!---->Recently however we added a new concept of partitioning which uses the partitioned attribute: `Set-Cookie: foo2=bar2; partitioned; ...(some other attributes)...`<!----></span><br>This opt-in attribute will partition the cookie by its domain as well as the top level site setting it (or nonce for anonymous frames). These partitioned cookies live alongside the "normal" cookies and it's possible for a given site to have both simultaneously.<span class="line"><!---->This opt-in attribute will partition the cookie by its domain as well as the top level site setting it (or nonce for anonymous frames). These partitioned cookies live alongside the "normal" cookies and it's possible for a given site to have both simultaneously.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        https://crbug.com/1427879<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1427879" title="Partitioned cookies and partitioned service worker interaction"><!---->https://crbug.com/1427879<!----></a> is fixed, so this bug *should* be fixed when storage partitioning ships in 113.<span class="line"><!----> is fixed, so this bug *should* be fixed when storage partitioning ships in 113.<!----></span><br><br>Once that is the case, service workers will be partitioned on StorageKey, which includes the nonce from the credentialless frame context. This should prevent workers registered by credentiallless, anonymous, or fenced frames from accessing unpartitioned cookies.<span class="line"><!---->Once that is the case, service workers will be partitioned on StorageKey, which includes the nonce from the credentialless frame context. This should prevent workers registered by credentiallless, anonymous, or fenced frames from accessing unpartitioned cookies.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Actually, one minor correction, the code patching <span class="line"><!---->Actually, one minor correction, the code patching <!----></span>crbug.com/1427879<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1427879" title="Partitioned cookies and partitioned service worker interaction"><!---->crbug.com/1427879<!----></a> will not go to stable until 114.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the reward amyressler@!<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the reward amyressler@!<!----></span><br>Just a quick question in case you want to reassess: on top of the very specific vulnerability this report also led to the discovery that the whole CHIPS implementation was partial as it was not considering any of the workers. This means that before the fixes when a worker was in use the the cookies were not partitioned with obvious impacts on the Site Isolation. I fell like that based on this and the fact that on average Site Isolation related bugs are paid 3.000$+ (I did a very quick search on the disclosed ones), maybe this one needs a re-assessment.<span class="line"><!---->Just a quick question in case you want to reassess: on top of the very specific vulnerability this report also led to the discovery that the whole CHIPS implementation was partial as it was not considering any of the workers. This means that before the fixes when a worker was in use the the cookies were not partitioned with obvious impacts on the Site Isolation. I fell like that based on this and the fact that on average Site Isolation related bugs are paid 3.000$+ (I did a very quick search on the disclosed ones), maybe this one needs a re-assessment.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Thank you for the nudge, smaury! We did re-evaluate this issue a few weeks ago, but it appears I did not provide that update here. Please accept my sincere apologies for the delay! <span class="line"><!---->Thank you for the nudge, smaury! We did re-evaluate this issue a few weeks ago, but it appears I did not provide that update here. Please accept my sincere apologies for the delay! <!----></span><br><br>The VRP Panel decided this reward amount was sufficient for this issue. As site isolation bypasses go, most that you point to are site isolation bypasses that are mitigated. This issue is more of one that is most impactful on devices that do not employ site isolation, so this would not be considered a site isolation bypass for the most part. In the aspects that this would be considered a site isolation bypass of a kind, it is fairly mitigated. <span class="line"><!---->The VRP Panel decided this reward amount was sufficient for this issue. As site isolation bypasses go, most that you point to are site isolation bypasses that are mitigated. This issue is more of one that is most impactful on devices that do not employ site isolation, so this would not be considered a site isolation bypass for the most part. In the aspects that this would be considered a site isolation bypass of a kind, it is fairly mitigated. <!----></span><br><br>In terms of assessment, based on mitigation (partially-mitigated COI credital-less bypass) and impact, this reward amount was considered appropriate for this issue.<span class="line"><!---->In terms of assessment, based on mitigation (partially-mitigated COI credital-less bypass) and impact, this reward amount was considered appropriate for this issue.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          <div class="input-grid">

            <div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        }

        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;

          }

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }

            flex-direction: column;
          }

            width: 100%;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

          }

          }

        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>
      
        <div class="container-outside" id="issue">
          <aside class="metadata-container">
            <mr-issue-metadata></mr-issue-metadata>
          </aside>
          <div class="container-issue">
            <div class="issue-header-container">
              <mr-issue-header></mr-issue-header>

              <mr-migrated-banner hidden=""></mr-migrated-banner>

            <div class="container-issue-content">
              <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);

          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;

        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }

      </style>

<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          
        <div class="keyboard-help">
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>

                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:

                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>

                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>

                </span>

            </div>

              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

          <optgroup label="My saved queries" hidden="">

              Manage my saved queries...
            </option>
          </optgroup>
        </select>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

            Issue 1420885: ServiceWorkers in credentialless iframes could access long lived cookies
